p: Already reported complicated epidemiological context of the concurrent circulating CHIKV, DENV, and ZIKV co-infections cannot be ignored. In French Polynesia, ZIKV infection was associated with autoimmune and neurological complications in the presence of co-circulating DENV ( 19). Further studies, genuine laboratory and clinical differential diagnostic tests among these infections is highly important to exclude the potential confounders, to unveil subsequent infections and co-infections by different arboviruses that can affect the course of the disease, their ways of transmission (vertical, perinatal, sexual) and the incidence of severe cases ( 5, 19, 48). The number of ZIKV related publications, guidelines, clinical cases, recommendations and circulating data (yet confirmed or not) is increasing day by day ( 1), therefore, standardized anthropometric applications, centralization of data ( 58), and advance experimental research is highly needed to confirm this relationship ( 9).
